sourceDesc.p: TEI-page files converted by Python to TEI-entry file

div.p: RAIPUR chief town of the above district and headquarters of the Chhatisgarh division of the Central Provinces, is situated in 21° 15' N. lat. and 81° 41' E. long., on a plateau 950 feet above sea-level. In 1881 its population amounted to 24,948 (12,447 males and 12,501 females). The modern town dates from 1830, and carries on a flourishing trade in grain, lac, cotton, Ac.
